Singapore Airlines turbulence: New Zealander injured on SQ321 in Intensive Care Unit in Thai hospital https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/singapore-airlines-turbulence-new-zealander-injured-on-sq321-has-31-stitches-after-flying-from-seat/3PFRTOEP6FBYBKF7ZJKDMTOOJ4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/singapore-airlines-turbulence-new-zealander-injured-on-sq321-has-31-stitches-after-flying-from-seat/3PFRTOEP6FBYBKF7ZJKDMTOOJ4/ A British man died on the flight. There were 23 Kiwis onboard, two hospitalised. Wed, 22 May 2024 22:09:00 +0000 Singapore Airlines confirmed a British man died onboard flight SQ321 and its chief executive extended his condolences to the man’s family. The airline said there were 'multiple' injuries on the flight. Photo / Getty Images
MPs’ pecuniary interests revealed: Multiple properties in Kāpiti among disclosed assets https://www.nzherald.co.nz/kapiti-news/news/mps-pecuniary-interests-revealed-multiple-properties-in-kapiti-among-disulated-assets/27G63BUTONFMXCX2XEAOFKXZ2M/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/kapiti-news/news/mps-pecuniary-interests-revealed-multiple-properties-in-kapiti-among-disulated-assets/27G63BUTONFMXCX2XEAOFKXZ2M/ Grace OdlumFour MPs own properties in Kāpiti. Wed, 22 May 2024 22:03:52 +0000 Ōtaki MP Tim Costley has declared ownership of a family home, two rental properties and a flat. Photo / David Haxton
SH26 blocked near Te Aroha after serious truck and van crash https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/sh26-blocked-near-te-aroha-after-serious-truck-and-van-crash/REU7EPNMKJDD5JJ4DLRZNSVJVU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/sh26-blocked-near-te-aroha-after-serious-truck-and-van-crash/REU7EPNMKJDD5JJ4DLRZNSVJVU/ Maryana GarciaPolice have reported serious injuries were sustained in the crash. Wed, 22 May 2024 21:35:53 +0000 State Highway 26 north of Te Aroha has been closed after a serious crash involving a truck and a van.

Kiwifruit: Zespri profit dips but growers paid record prices for fruit https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/kiwifruit-zespri-profit-dips-but-growers-paid-record-prices-for-fruit/PD4672SMVFBLRHUD2ZIEDPVFJY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/kiwifruit-zespri-profit-dips-but-growers-paid-record-prices-for-fruit/PD4672SMVFBLRHUD2ZIEDPVFJY/ Green kiwifruit growers paid $9.55 a tray, up from $5.78 for the 2022-23 season. Wed, 22 May 2024 21:07:29 +0000 Green kiwifruit growers saw the biggest jump in prices for the 2023-24 season. Photo / Bevan Conley
Northland kaumātua vows to stay on Moturua Island for the rest of his life https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/northland-kaumatua-vows-to-stay-on-moturua-island-for-the-rest-of-his-life/AIPSQUOA65GKDGZYKMSTTIMZX4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/northland-kaumatua-vows-to-stay-on-moturua-island-for-the-rest-of-his-life/AIPSQUOA65GKDGZYKMSTTIMZX4/ Matutaera Clendon has been living illegally on what is now a scenic reserve. Wed, 22 May 2024 21:03:35 +0000 Matutaera Clendon (centre), with nephew John Clendon and partner Bronna Brown at Whare Otupoho, a tiny house built on a DoC reserve on Moturua Island. Photo / RNZ
Where is the love? LGBTQIA+ telephone box attack saddens Levin artist https://www.nzherald.co.nz/horowhenua-chronicle/news/where-is-the-love-lgbtqia-telephone-box-attack-saddens-levin-artist/QXXJ5B5CAFE43PA7BARMTLAOV4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/horowhenua-chronicle/news/where-is-the-love-lgbtqia-telephone-box-attack-saddens-levin-artist/QXXJ5B5CAFE43PA7BARMTLAOV4/ Paul WilliamsPainting over the colourful box has been seen as an attack on the LGBTQIA+ community. Wed, 22 May 2024 20:50:37 +0000 The Chorus box in the centre of Levin with an artwork representing the LGTBQIA+ community has been bombed with grey paint.
Portrait of Māori climate activist Tuhi-Ao Bailey wins $20,000 Adam Portraiture Award https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/portrait-of-maori-climate-activist-tuhi-ao-bailey-wins-20000-adam-portraiture-award/IGQURM6A2BHO7P4M7XVLHAEYTA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/portrait-of-maori-climate-activist-tuhi-ao-bailey-wins-20000-adam-portraiture-award/IGQURM6A2BHO7P4M7XVLHAEYTA/ Melissa NightingaleArtist Maryanne Shearman said she wanted to paint someone who deserved to be painted. Wed, 22 May 2024 20:46:26 +0000 Maryanne Shearman has won this year's Adam Portraiture Award.
